chapter.introduction: In the first class of the second semester, I review the course format and syllabus. In the time remaining, we spend some time working on problems that review some of the fundamental concepts from the first semester.

li.p: Prove that if f and g are bijections on a set X, then g \circ f is also a bijection on X.
Partition the set X=\{k \in \mathbb{Z} \mid -10 \leq k \leq 10\} into equivalence classes
Prove, by mathematical induction, that F_0 + F_1 + F_2 + \cdots + F_{n} = F_{n+2} - 1, where F_n is the nth Fibonacci number (F_0 = 1, F_1 = 1 and F_n = F_{n-1} + F_{n-2}).
